required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Pemetrexed Plus Carboplatin, or Pemetrexed Plus Cisplatin With Radiation Therapy Followed by Pemetrexed in Patients With Inoperable Non-Small-Cell Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1/2 Study of Pemetrexed (Alimta) Plus Carboplatin, or Pemetrexed Plus Cisplatin With Concurrent Radiation Therapy Followed by Every-21-Day Pemetrexed Consolidation in Patients With Favorable-Prognosis Inoperable Stage IIIA/B Non-Small-Cell Lung Cancer (NSCLC)

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to determine the 2-year survival rate of both of the chemotherapy regimens in patients with inoperable non-small-cell lung cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 - Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Carboplatin
primary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 1 enrollment to the end of study treatment up to Week 11
primary_outcome.description: MTD was defined as a dose at which the occurrence of at least 2 dose-limiting toxicities (DLTs) was observed. DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the entire radiation therapy (RT) course, including a 2-week recovery period following completion of RT: Grade 4 neutropenia (<0.5 x 10^9 cells per liter) lasting >7 days, febrile neutropenia; ≥Grade 3 neutropenia with fever >38.5 degrees Celsius (°C), Grade 4 thrombocytopenia, Grade 3 thrombocytopenia with ≥Grade 2 bleeding, ≥Grade 3 nonhematologic toxicity (excluding nausea, vomiting, and transaminase elevations) and ≥Grade 3 pulmonary or esophageal toxicity (radiation-related pneumonitis or esophagitis).

primary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 - Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Cisplatin
primary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 1 enrollment to the end of study treatment up to Week 11
primary_outcome.description: MTD was defined as a dose at which the occurrence of at least 2 dose-limiting toxicities (DLTs) was observed. DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the entire radiation therapy (RT) course, including a 2-week recovery period following completion of RT: Grade 4 neutropenia (<0.5 x 10^9 cells per liter) lasting >7 days, febrile neutropenia; ≥Grade 3 neutropenia with fever >38.5 degrees Celsius (°C), Grade 4 thrombocytopenia, Grade 3 thrombocytopenia with ≥Grade 2 bleeding, ≥Grade 3 nonhematologic toxicity (excluding nausea, vomiting, and transaminase elevations) and ≥Grade 3 pulmonary or esophageal toxicity (radiation-related pneumonitis or esophagitis).

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 - Pharmacology Toxicity: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
secondary_outcome.description: Phase 1 pharmacology toxicity was defined as the number of participants experiencing dose limiting toxicities (DLTs). DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the entire radiation therapy (RT) course: Grade 4 neutropenia (<0.5 x 10^9 cells per liter) >7 days, febrile neutropenia, ≥Grade 3 neutropenia with fever >38.5 degrees Celsius (°C), Grade 4 thrombocytopenia, Grade 3 thrombocytopenia with ≥Grade 2 bleeding, ≥Grade 3 nonhematologic toxicity (excluding nausea, vomiting, and transaminase elevations), and ≥Grade 3 pulmonary or esophageal toxicity (radiation-related pneumonitis or esophagitis). Grade 5 events are the events leading to the death.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 1 - Percentage of Participants With Complete Response or Partial Response (Response Rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 1 enrollment to the end of the study treatment up to Week 11
secondary_outcome.description: Response rate is the percentage of participants with complete response (CR) or partial response (PR), as assessed according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines. CR is disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. Response rate is calculated as a total number of participants with CR or PR divided by the total number of participants treated multiplied by 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 2 - Pharmacology Toxicity: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 randomization to the end of the study treatment up to 30.0 months
secondary_outcome.description: Phase 2 pharmacology toxicity was defined as the number of participants who experienced serious adverse events or all other nonserious adverse events during the study. A summary of serious adverse events and other nonserious adverse events is located in the Reported Adverse Events section.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 randomization to measured disease progression up to 24 months
secondary_outcome.description: Time to disease progression was measured from randomization of Study Phase 2 to the first observation of disease progression according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Disease progression is ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions and/or a new lesion.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 randomization to death as the result of any cause up to 30.0 month

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 2 - Percentage of Participants With Complete Response or Partial Response (Response Rate)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 randomization to the end of the treatment up to 30.0 months
secondary_outcome.description: Response rate is the percentage of participants with complete response (CR) or partial response (PR), as assessed according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines. CR is disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. Response rate is calculated as a total number of participants with CR or PR divided by the total number of participants treated multiplied by 100.

intervention.description: Phase 1 - 500 milligram/meter squared (mg/m²), administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles Phase 2 - 500 mg/m², administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation therapy for each phase
Phase 1 - 30 mg/m² and 75 mg/m², administered intravenously, Days 1, 8, 22, 29 and 43 Phase 2 - 75 mg/m², administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles

Phase 1 - dosed at area under the curve (AUC) 2 milligram/milliliter*minute (mg/mL*min), administered intravenously, Days 1, 8, 22, 29 and 43 Phase 2 - dosed at AUC 5 mg/mL*min, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles
Phase 1 - 2 Gray, daily, 5 days a week for Days 1-51 Phase 2 - 2 Gray, daily, 5 days a week for Days 1-45

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Inoperable non small cell lung cancer
- No weight loss greater than 10% in 3 months prior to enrolling in trial
- Adequate kidney function
- Adequate liver function
- Adequate lung function
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous surgery to remove lung tumor
- Previous chemotherapy or radiation therapy or lung cancer
- Inability to take vitamin supplementation
- Heart attack within past 6 months
- Active infection

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin (Study Phase 1)
group.description: 500 milligrams/meter squared (mg/m²) pemetrexed (Pem) every 21 days for 3 cycles + Carboplatin (Carbo) dosed at area under the curve (AUC) 2 milligram/milliliter*minute (mg/mL*min) on Days 1, 8, 22, 29, 43 + radiation therapy (RT) 74 Grays (Gy) total dose given 2 Gy/day over 51 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin (Study Phase 1)
group.description: 500 mg/m² pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Cisplatin (Cis) 30 mg/m² or 75 mg/m² on Days 1, 8, 22, 29, 43 + radiation therapy 74 Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 51 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin (Study Phase 2)
group.description: 500 mg/m² pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Carboplatin dosed at AUC 5 mg/mL*min every 21 days for 3 cycles + radiation therapy 64-68 Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 45 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin (Study Phase 2)
group.description: 500 mg/m² pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Cisplatin 75 mg/m² every 21 days for 3 cycles + radiation therapy 64-68 Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 45 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin (Study Phase 1)
group.description: 500 milligrams/meter squared (mg/m²) pemetrexed (Pem) every 21 days for 3 cycles + Carboplatin (Carbo) dosed at area under the curve (AUC) 2 milligram/milliliter*minute (mg/mL*min) on Days 1, 8, 22, 29, 43 + radiation therapy (RT) 74 Grays (Gy) total dose given 2 Gy/day over 51 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Phase 1 - Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Carboplatin
outcome.description: MTD was defined as a dose at which the occurrence of at least 2 dose-limiting toxicities (DLTs) was observed. DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the entire radiation therapy (RT) course, including a 2-week recovery period following completion of RT: Grade 4 neutropenia (<0.5 x 10^9 cells per liter) lasting >7 days, febrile neutropenia; ≥Grade 3 neutropenia with fever >38.5 degrees Celsius (°C), Grade 4 thrombocytopenia, Grade 3 thrombocytopenia with ≥Grade 2 bleeding, ≥Grade 3 nonhematologic toxicity (excluding nausea, vomiting, and transaminase elevations) and ≥Grade 3 pulmonary or esophageal toxicity (radiation-related pneumonitis or esophagitis).
outcome.time_frame: Phase 1 enrollment to the end of study treatment up to Week 11
outcome.population: All participants who were enrolled in Study Phase 1 and completed at least 6 weeks of pemetrexed + carboplatin treatment.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin Treatment Group
group.description: 500 milligrams/meter squared (mg/m²) pemetrexed (Pem) every 21 days for 3 cycles + Carboplatin (Carbo) dosed at area under the curve (AUC) 2 milligram/milliliter*minute (mg/mL*min) on Days 1, 8, 22, 29, 43 + radiation therapy (RT) 74 Grays (Gy) total dose given 2 Gy/day over 51 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

measure.title: Phase 1 - Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Carboplatin
measure.description: MTD was defined as a dose at which the occurrence of at least 2 dose-limiting toxicities (DLTs) was observed. DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the entire radiation therapy (RT) course, including a 2-week recovery period following completion of RT: Grade 4 neutropenia (<0.5 x 10^9 cells per liter) lasting >7 days, febrile neutropenia; ≥Grade 3 neutropenia with fever >38.5 degrees Celsius (°C), Grade 4 thrombocytopenia, Grade 3 thrombocytopenia with ≥Grade 2 bleeding, ≥Grade 3 nonhematologic toxicity (excluding nausea, vomiting, and transaminase elevations) and ≥Grade 3 pulmonary or esophageal toxicity (radiation-related pneumonitis or esophagitis).
measure.population: All participants who were enrolled in Study Phase 1 and completed at least 6 weeks of pemetrexed + carboplatin treatment.

measurement_list.measurement: MTD was not reached because 2 DLTs threshold wasn't reached.

outcome.title: Phase 1 - Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Cisplatin
outcome.description: MTD was defined as a dose at which the occurrence of at least 2 dose-limiting toxicities (DLTs) was observed. DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the entire radiation therapy (RT) course, including a 2-week recovery period following completion of RT: Grade 4 neutropenia (<0.5 x 10^9 cells per liter) lasting >7 days, febrile neutropenia; ≥Grade 3 neutropenia with fever >38.5 degrees Celsius (°C), Grade 4 thrombocytopenia, Grade 3 thrombocytopenia with ≥Grade 2 bleeding, ≥Grade 3 nonhematologic toxicity (excluding nausea, vomiting, and transaminase elevations) and ≥Grade 3 pulmonary or esophageal toxicity (radiation-related pneumonitis or esophagitis).
outcome.time_frame: Phase 1 enrollment to the end of study treatment up to Week 11
outcome.population: All participants who were enrolled in Study Phase 1 and completed at least 6 weeks of pemetrexed + cisplatin treatment.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin Treatment Group
group.description: 500 milligrams/meter squared (mg/m²) pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Cisplatin (Cis) 30 mg/m² or 75 mg/m² on Days 1, 8, 22, 29, 43 + radiation therapy 74 Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 51 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

measure.title: Phase 1 - Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) of Cisplatin
measure.description: MTD was defined as a dose at which the occurrence of at least 2 dose-limiting toxicities (DLTs) was observed. DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the entire radiation therapy (RT) course, including a 2-week recovery period following completion of RT: Grade 4 neutropenia (<0.5 x 10^9 cells per liter) lasting >7 days, febrile neutropenia; ≥Grade 3 neutropenia with fever >38.5 degrees Celsius (°C), Grade 4 thrombocytopenia, Grade 3 thrombocytopenia with ≥Grade 2 bleeding, ≥Grade 3 nonhematologic toxicity (excluding nausea, vomiting, and transaminase elevations) and ≥Grade 3 pulmonary or esophageal toxicity (radiation-related pneumonitis or esophagitis).
measure.population: All participants who were enrolled in Study Phase 1 and completed at least 6 weeks of pemetrexed + cisplatin treatment.

measurement_list.measurement: MTD was not reached because 2 DLTs threshold wasn't reached.

outcome.title: Phase 1 - Pharmacology Toxicity: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
outcome.description: Phase 1 pharmacology toxicity was defined as the number of participants experiencing dose limiting toxicities (DLTs). DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the entire radiation therapy (RT) course: Grade 4 neutropenia (<0.5 x 10^9 cells per liter) >7 days, febrile neutropenia, ≥Grade 3 neutropenia with fever >38.5 degrees Celsius (°C), Grade 4 thrombocytopenia, Grade 3 thrombocytopenia with ≥Grade 2 bleeding, ≥Grade 3 nonhematologic toxicity (excluding nausea, vomiting, and transaminase elevations), and ≥Grade 3 pulmonary or esophageal toxicity (radiation-related pneumonitis or esophagitis). Grade 5 events are the events leading to the death.
outcome.population: All participants who were enrolled in Study Phase 1 and received at least 1 dose of study drug and 1 dose of radiation therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin Treatment Group
group.description: 500 milligrams/meter squared (mg/m²) pemetrexed (Pem) every 21 days for 3 cycles + Carboplatin (Carbo) dosed at area under the curve (AUC) 2 milligram/milliliter*minute (mg/mL*min) on Days 1, 8, 22, 29, 43 + radiation therapy (RT) 74 Grays (Gy) total dose given 2 Gy/day over 51 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin Treatment
group.description: 500 mg/m² pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Cisplatin (Cis) 30 mg/m² or 75 mg/m² on Days 1, 8, 22, 29, 43 + radiation therapy 74 Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 51 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

measure.title: Phase 1 - Pharmacology Toxicity: Number of Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicities (DLTs)
measure.description: Phase 1 pharmacology toxicity was defined as the number of participants experiencing dose limiting toxicities (DLTs). DLT was defined as any of the following events occurring during the entire radiation therapy (RT) course: Grade 4 neutropenia (<0.5 x 10^9 cells per liter) >7 days, febrile neutropenia, ≥Grade 3 neutropenia with fever >38.5 degrees Celsius (°C), Grade 4 thrombocytopenia, Grade 3 thrombocytopenia with ≥Grade 2 bleeding, ≥Grade 3 nonhematologic toxicity (excluding nausea, vomiting, and transaminase elevations), and ≥Grade 3 pulmonary or esophageal toxicity (radiation-related pneumonitis or esophagitis). Grade 5 events are the events leading to the death.
measure.population: All participants who were enrolled in Study Phase 1 and received at least 1 dose of study drug and 1 dose of radiation therapy.

outcome.title: Phase 1 - Percentage of Participants With Complete Response or Partial Response (Response Rate)
outcome.description: Response rate is the percentage of participants with complete response (CR) or partial response (PR), as assessed according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines. CR is disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. Response rate is calculated as a total number of participants with CR or PR divided by the total number of participants treated multiplied by 100.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 1 enrollment to the end of the study treatment up to Week 11
outcome.population: All participants who were enrolled in Study Phase 1 and received at least 1 dose of study drug and 1 dose of radiation therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin Treatment Group
group.description: 500 milligrams/meter squared (mg/m²) pemetrexed (Pem) every 21 days for 3 cycles + Carboplatin (Carbo) dosed at area under the curve (AUC) 2 milligram/milliliter*minute (mg/mL*min) on Days 1, 8, 22, 29, 43 + radiation therapy (RT) 74 Grays (Gy) total dose given 2 Gy/day over 51 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin Treatment
group.description: 500 mg/m² pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Cisplatin (Cis) 30 mg/m² or 75 mg/m² on Days 1, 8, 22, 29, 43 + radiation therapy 74 Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 51 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

measure.title: Phase 1 - Percentage of Participants With Complete Response or Partial Response (Response Rate)
measure.description: Response rate is the percentage of participants with complete response (CR) or partial response (PR), as assessed according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines. CR is disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. Response rate is calculated as a total number of participants with CR or PR divided by the total number of participants treated multiplied by 100.
measure.population: All participants who were enrolled in Study Phase 1 and received at least 1 dose of study drug and 1 dose of radiation therapy.

outcome.title: Phase 2 - Pharmacology Toxicity: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
outcome.description: Phase 2 pharmacology toxicity was defined as the number of participants who experienced serious adverse events or all other nonserious adverse events during the study. A summary of serious adverse events and other nonserious adverse events is located in the Reported Adverse Events section.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 randomization to the end of the study treatment up to 30.0 months
outcome.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug or 1 dose of radiation therapy (RT) during Study Phase 2.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin Treatment Group
group.description: 500 milligrams/meter squared (mg/m²) pemetrexed (Pem) every 21 days for 3 cycles + Carboplatin (Carbo) dosed at area under the curve (AUC) 5 milligram/milliliter*minute (mg/mL*min) every 21 days for 3 cycles + radiation therapy (RT) 64-68 (Gray) Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 45 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin Treatment Group
group.description: 500 mg/m² pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Cisplatin (Cis) 75 mg/m² every 21 days for 3 cycles + radiation therapy 64-68 Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 45 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

measure.title: Phase 2 - Pharmacology Toxicity: Number of Participants With Adverse Events
measure.description: Phase 2 pharmacology toxicity was defined as the number of participants who experienced serious adverse events or all other nonserious adverse events during the study. A summary of serious adverse events and other nonserious adverse events is located in the Reported Adverse Events section.
measure.population: All randomized participants who received at least 1 dose of study drug or 1 dose of radiation therapy (RT) during Study Phase 2.

outcome.title: Phase 2 - Time to Progression
outcome.description: Time to disease progression was measured from randomization of Study Phase 2 to the first observation of disease progression according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Disease progression is ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions and/or a new lesion.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 randomization to measured disease progression up to 24 months
outcome.population: All randomized participants in Study Phase 2.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin Treatment Group
group.description: 500 milligrams/meter squared (mg/m²) pemetrexed (Pem) every 21 days for 3 cycles + Carboplatin (Carbo) dosed at area under the curve (AUC) 5 milligram/milliliter*minute (mg/mL*min) every 21 days for 3 cycles + radiation therapy (RT) 64-68 (Gray) Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 45 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin Treatment Group
group.description: 500 mg/m² pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Cisplatin (Cis) 75 mg/m² every 21 days for 3 cycles + radiation therapy 64-68 Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 45 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

measure.title: Phase 2 - Time to Progression
measure.description: Time to disease progression was measured from randomization of Study Phase 2 to the first observation of disease progression according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) criteria. Disease progression is ≥20% increase in sum of longest diameter of target lesions and/or a new lesion.
measure.population: All randomized participants in Study Phase 2.

measurement_list.measurement: The upper limit of the 95% confidence interval was not calculable because an insufficient number of participants reached the event at the final time point for assessment.

outcome.title: Phase 2 - Median Survival
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 randomization to death as the result of any cause up to 30.0 month
outcome.population: All randomized participants in Study Phase 2.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin Treatment Group

The upper limit of the 95% confidence interval was not calculable because an insufficient number of participants reached the event at the final time point for assessment.

outcome.title: Phase 2 - Percentage of Participants With Complete Response or Partial Response (Response Rate)
outcome.description: Response rate is the percentage of participants with complete response (CR) or partial response (PR), as assessed according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines. CR is disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. Response rate is calculated as a total number of participants with CR or PR divided by the total number of participants treated multiplied by 100.
outcome.time_frame: Phase 2 randomization to the end of the treatment up to 30.0 months
outcome.population: All randomization participants in Study Phase 2.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin Treatment Group
group.description: 500 milligrams/meter squared (mg/m²) pemetrexed (Pem) every 21 days for 3 cycles + Carboplatin (Carbo) dosed at area under the curve (AUC) 5 milligram/milliliter*minute (mg/mL*min) every 21 days for 3 cycles + radiation therapy (RT) 64-68 (Gray) Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 45 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

group.title: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin Treatment Group
group.description: 500 mg/m² pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Cisplatin (Cis) 75 mg/m² every 21 days for 3 cycles + radiation therapy 64-68 Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 45 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

measure.title: Phase 2 - Percentage of Participants With Complete Response or Partial Response (Response Rate)
measure.description: Response rate is the percentage of participants with complete response (CR) or partial response (PR), as assessed according to the Response Evaluation Criteria In Solid Tumors (RECIST) guidelines. CR is disappearance of all target and non-target lesions; PR is ≥30% decrease in sum of longest diameter of target lesions. Response rate is calculated as a total number of participants with CR or PR divided by the total number of participants treated multiplied by 100.
measure.population: All randomization participants in Study Phase 2.

outcome.title: Phase 2 - Survival Probability at 2 Years
outcome.population: All randomized participants in Study Phase 2.

Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

measure.title: Phase 2 - Survival Probability at 2 Years
measure.population: All randomized participants in Study Phase 2.

group.title: Phase 1: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: 500 milligrams/meter squared (mg/m²) pemetrexed (pem) every 21 days for 3 cycles + Carboplatin (Carbo) dosed at area under the curve (AUC) 2 milligram/milliliter*minute (mg/mL*min) on Days 1, 8, 22, 29, 43 + radiation therapy (RT) 74 Grays (Gy) total dose given 2 Gy/day over 51 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

group.title: Phase 1: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin
group.description: 500 mg/m² pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Cisplatin (Cis) 30 mg/m² or 75 mg/m² on Days 1, 8, 22, 29, 43 + radiation therapy 74 Grays (Gy) total dose given 2 Gy/day over 51 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

group.title: Phase 2: Pemetrexed + Carboplatin
group.description: 500 mg/m² pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Carboplatin dosed at AUC 5 mg/mL*min every 21 days for 3 cycles + radiation therapy 64-68 Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 45 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Carbo + RT) therapy.

group.title: Phase 2: Pemetrexed + Cisplatin
group.description: 500 mg/m² pemetrexed every 21 days for 3 cycles + Cisplatin 75 mg/m² every 21 days for 3 cycles + radiation therapy 64-68 Gy total dose given 2 Gy/day over 45 days. Consolidation Therapy - 500 mg/m² pemetrexed, administered intravenously, every 21 days for 3 cycles beginning 3 weeks after completion of chemoradiation (Pem + Cis + RT) therapy.

event.description: One of the events resulted in a discontinuation due to death.
The event in Pemetrexed + Cisplatin resulted in a discontinuation due to death.
This event resulted in a discontinuation due to death.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

event.description: This event resulted in a discontinuation due to death.
The event in Pemetrexed + Cisplatin treatment group resulted in a discontinuation due to death.
This event resulted in a discontinuation due to death.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
